page.title: 17Cemeteries
page.content: Dorchester cemetery, on the Southern outskirts, is on the Weymouth road. It was opened in 1856 and is managed by the town's Joint Burial Committee. It covers 7 acres and about 11,000 people are buried there. At the gate is a lodge and just inside are two identical stone chapels. The{North {Chapel}is being refurbished as a memorial chapel and the{South Chapel is used by all denominations. In the SE corner is a group of ornate Italian marble statues erected by local{gypsy {families}such as the Penfolds and Benhams. These graves are decorated with artificial flowers and photos of the deceased. Members of{prominent {local families,}eg the Popes and Treves are buried here and there are also some war graves in the cemetery. Two more disused graveyards are at churches in Came and Whitcombe.
